Posts.EditableText:
Ok i'm new so let me apologize for asking this question.
I'm doing Quest, and i'm trying to let the player question another character.
I'm putting everything in, I put all the questions in the Ask/Tell, But whenever I put anything in during the game, I can't question him at all.
I don't even know if I'm starting this the right way .
Can anyone help me? I appreciate it.
Posts.HTML:
Ok i'm new so let me apologize for asking this question.
I'm doing Quest, and i'm trying to let the player question another character.
I'm putting everything in, I put all the questions in the Ask/Tell, But whenever I put anything in during the game, I can't question him at all.
I don't even know if I'm starting this the right way .
Can anyone help me? I appreciate it.

I haven't used 'tell' much, but the 'ask/Ask' is merely a 'yes:true/no:false' Question:

ask ("Are you a male?") {
  // quest automatically (hidden from you) sets the 'result' Variable to your selection: result = your_selection_choice
  if (result) {
    player.sex = "male"
  } else {
    player.sex = "female"
  }
}

Posts.EditableText:
Hmmm... Can you tell me anything other than that?

Posts.HTML: Take a look at these pics and make sure you have it set up like this:

Posts.EditableText: Also, if you are asking about terms... I think you need to make it all one word (grimheldfamily). This will distinguish between grimheldfamily and smithfamily. If you type in ask librarian about man versus and the librarian has two men in her ask box (young man and old man) there is no way to determine which you want to ask about.
Posts.HTML:
Also, if you are asking about terms... I think you need to make it all one word (grimheldfamily). This will distinguish between grimheldfamily and smithfamily.

If you type in ask librarian about man versus and the librarian has two men in her ask box (young man and old man) there is no way to determine which you want to ask about.
